009package imagingbook.common.morphology;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.morphology.StructuringElements.reflect;
012
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Implements a binary morphological erosion operation.
018 * See Sec. 7.2.4 of [1] for additional details.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>,
022 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
023 * </p>
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/09/18
027 */
028public class BinaryErosion extends BinaryMorphologyFilter {
029        
030        /**
031         * Constructor, creates a {@link BinaryErosion} with a 3x3 box structuring element by default.
032         */
033        public BinaryErosion() {
034                super();
035        }
036        
037        /**
038         * Constructor, creates a {@link BinaryErosion} with the specified structuring element.
039         * @param H the structuring element
040         */
041        public BinaryErosion(byte[][] H) {
042                super(H);
043        }
044
045        @Override
046        public void applyTo(ByteProcessor bp) {
047                // dilates the background
048                bp.invert();
049                new BinaryDilation(reflect(H)).applyTo(bp); //dilate(ip, reflect(H));
050                bp.invert();
051        }
052
053}
